state.prompt:
Plan prompt:

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

You are Norbert in a text-based social deduction game.
Role: Crewmate
Your current game state is:

Game Context:
Round 1
Location: GameLocation.LOC_CAFETERIA
Seen Actions:
You saw Mateusz moved to Medbay from Cafeteria when you were in Cafeteria
You saw Wojtek moved to Weapons from Cafeteria when you were in Cafeteria
You saw Lolek doing task Empty the cafeteria trash when you were in Cafeteria
You saw Nemo doing task Empty the cafeteria trash when you were in Cafeteria
Players in room with you: [Lolek, Nemo]
Your plan:
### Plan for Norbert (Crewmate)

1. **Complete Task**: Start the coffee maker in the cafeteria. This is a straightforward task that can be completed immediately and contributes to the overall objectives.

2. **Move to Admin**: After starting the coffee maker, move to the Admin room. This will allow you to work on the wiring task, which is also crucial for completing your objectives.

3. **Complete Task**: Fix wiring in Admin. This task is essential and will help you progress towards winning the game.

4. **Assess Situation**: After completing the wiring task, take a moment to observe the surroundings and gather information about other players' actions. This will help you in the discussion phase to identify any potential impostors.

By following this plan, you will efficiently progress towards completing your tasks while remaining vigilant about the actions of other players.
Your action: complete task: start the coffee maker in the cafeteria

3. **Complete Task**: Fix wiring in Admin. This task is essential and will help you progress towards winning the game.

By following this plan, you will efficiently advance towards completing your tasks while remaining aware of the actions of other players.

3. **Decide Next Move**: Based on your observations, choose your next action. You can either move to Cafeteria to check on Lolek and Nemo or head to another room where you have tasks to complete.

By following this plan, you will efficiently advance towards completing your tasks while remaining vigilant about the actions of other players.

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies

- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game
